title: Demo Services Engineer (front end developer)
description:
General information
Country
Sweden


City
Linkoping


Job ID
44724


Department
Sales


Description & Requirements
The primary role of the *Global Demo Innovation Services* Team is to help enable new sales by enhancing standard products and creating customized solutions to meet specific requirements for demonstrations. Our technical knowledge combined with presales and product development experience allows us to quickly understand prospect requirements and build custom demo solutions.

  

JOB SUMMARY:


Are you highly creative and interested in learning new applications and technologies? Do you like problem solving and have the drive to continuously improve your skills? Are you able to quickly switch between several high priority tasks while maintaining focus? We are expanding our Global Demo Innovation Services Team at Infor.


For this position we are seeking a highly motivated individual that will be working directly with presales (Solution Consultants) to come up with new innovative ways of selling our software. You will be responsible for understanding their business requirements, figuring out the best way to meet these requirements and finally to create the demo solution (I.e. functional prototype). This is done in close collaboration with the solution consultant and since we are providing a service it is important that you like working with people. This is a non-prospect/customer facing position.


To be successful in the Demo Services Team you also need a can-do attitude, a strong inner drive and have a genuine love of technology. We need you to be a team player, but you will get the opportunity to shine as well.

  

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Gain a complete understanding of all technical aspects of Infor products in assigned areas.
* Improving demo capabilities by designing, implementing, and communicating key features to ensure best possible demonstrations.
* Conceptualize, design, and build demo solutions with guidance from technical and functional solution consultants.
* Provide informal training and skill-transfer sessions on solutions and procedures delivered by the group.
* Ability to adopt new technologies to drive innovation and improvement of Infor products.
  

  

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

* Bachelor's degree in business, software engineering, computer science or equivalent.
* Strong knowledge of modern web technologies.
  

  

REQUIRED SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:

* Acting as point of contact and focal point for solution consultants, both proactively and in support situations.
* Being capable of developing proof-of-concept demo solutions (I.e. functional prototypes).
* Ability to work effectively under pressure, prioritize tasks and meet tight deadlines.
* Excellent creative problem-solving skills.
* Passion for innovative technologies.
* Very good organizational, analytical, and communications skills.
* Curiosity, willingness, and ability to continuously learn new areas.
* Self-starter with strong work ethics and the ability to work independently as well as in teams.
* Very good Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* Service minded.
  

  

PREFERRED SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:

* 3-5 years of experience from Solution and Business Consulting.
* Experience working with Generative AI as a tool throughout the development and documentation cycle.
* Experience working with Infor technology / extensibility tools.
  

  

OTHER:

* We support presales globally. You may be required to work odd hours on occasion to support our people in other geographic locations.
* We trust our team members to have strong work ethics. For us, *freedom under responsibility* is more than a nice punchline – it is a guiding principle.
* Collaboration drives innovation. Therefore we ask everyone to be in the office at least three days a week.
  

  

  

About Infor  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
For more information visit www.infor.com  


Our Values  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.

title: Full Stack Developer internship
description:
Full Stack Developer Internship
 



**Location:** 
  Bromma, Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 Quick Summary
 


* **Experience:** 
  2–3 years of hands-on web development
* **Core Skills:** 
  React JS, Redux, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, NodeJS, MongoDB, Redis, REST APIs
* **Nice to Have:** 
  Docker, Ansible, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Elastic Search, Traefik, Cloudflare
* **Start Date:** 
  Mid to end of September 2025
* **Company:** 
  Dream Troopers AB (est. 2015), delivering SaaS and marketplace solutions in 5 countries
* **Products:** 
  Cruncho.com (SaaS Event Management) & Soulcircus.com (Wellness Marketplace)



 About Us
 



  





 Founded in 2015 in Stockholm, Dream Troopers AB is a multi-award-winning tech company with big ambitions and a small, driven team.
 


* **Cruncho Events** 
 : A SaaS white-label event management platform used by municipalities, tourism boards, and local media in five countries. In 2024, our solution was chosen by 
 *Atout France* 
  and the 
 *French Ministry of Tourism* 
  to power events around the Paris Olympic and Paralympic Games.
* **Soulcircus.com** 
 : Our fast-growing B2C marketplace connecting individuals and companies with alternative wellness, preventive health, and personal growth practitioners. Currently live in Sweden, with international expansion ahead.



 We’re passionate about building tech with real impact — tools that connect people, communities, and ideas.
 



  





 The Role
 



 We’re looking for a 
 **Full Stack Developer Intern** 
  — someone with real coding experience (2–3 years), who thrives in fast-moving projects and wants to sharpen their skills in a startup environment.
 



 This is not a “watch and learn” internship. You’ll be part of the core team, working alongside other Full Stack Developers, our Production Manager, and a UI/UX Designer — and collaborating directly with the CEO. You’ll take ownership of real features that power our platforms and see your work go live.
 



 If you’re ambitious, curious, and eager to contribute, this is an opportunity to level up your skills while building products with real-world reach.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* Contribute to development planning and sprint execution
* Build and maintain features across the full stack: event calendars, APIs, payments, and admin modules
* Manage and optimize databases (MongoDB, Elastic Search)
* Troubleshoot issues, optimize performance, and ensure reliability
* Support security best practices and compliance
* Assist with CI/CD and container-based deployments
* Collaborate closely with the tech and business teams — we share responsibility for the product as a whole



 Requirements
 


* Pursuing or holding a Master’s degree in Computer Science (KTH, Chalmers, Stockholm University, or similar)
* 2–3 years of practical web development experience
* Strong skills in React JS, Redux, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, NodeJS, MongoDB, Redis, and REST APIs
* Familiarity with agile/scrum workflows and startup environments
* Excellent written and spoken English (Swedish is a plus)



  





**You are:** 
  proactive, detail-oriented, and a self-starter. You enjoy solving problems, working independently, and collaborating in a team. You learn quickly, adapt easily, and bring both optimism and a sense of humor to your work.
 



  





 Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)
 


* Experience with Docker, Ansible, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, Elastic Search, Traefik, Cloudflare
* Analytics tools (Grafana, Google Analytics, Simple Analytics)
* Integrating third-party APIs or web scraping



  





 What We Offer
 


* A meaningful internship where your code goes into production
* A collaborative and creative environment with a strong team spirit
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth
* A modern office space in Bromma, with a co-working environment, yoga/meditation studio, complimentary breakfast & fruit, and after-work gatherings
* Flexible working hours for healthy work-life balance
* Competitive internship compensation
* Possibility of transitioning into a full-time permanent role after the internship



  





 Position Details
 


* **Role:** 
  1x Full Stack Developer Internship
* **Start:** 
  Mid / End of September 2025
* **Duration:** 
  5–6 months (full-time)
* **Compensation:** 
  Yes
* **Location:** 
  Johannesfred, Bromma, Stockholm



  





 Learn more about us: cruncho.com | soulcircus.com
 



 Questions? Reach out at 
 **hello@cruncho.com**

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens energilandskap och göra verklig skillnad för kommande generationer?
 



  





 Vi söker dig som vill vara med och vidareutveckla vår molnplattform Enerhive – och som brinner för att bygga robusta, skalbara och smarta lösningar. Hos oss på Ntricity Technologies blir du inte en i mängden, utan en nyckelspelare i ett litet team med stor påverkan.
 



  





 Tillsammans bygger vi tekniken som gör förnybar energi lönsam och tillgänglig för alla.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Du blir en del av vårt utvecklingsteam som i dag består av sex personer. Det är vi som utvecklar Enerhive, vår molnplattform som kopplar ihop batterier, vindkrafts- och solcellsparker med energimarknaden. Plattformen genererar optimerade bud och körscheman baserat på faktorer som väder, pris och resursanvändning.
 



  





 Vi söker nu en fullstackutvecklare som vill ta stort ansvar för hur vi bygger vår serverlogik, datahantering och API-design. Du kommer ha en nyckelroll i vidareutvecklingen av plattformens kärnfunktioner, med möjlighet att påverka både arkitektur och teknikval.
 



  





 Du arbetar i hela kedjan, men med tyngdpunkt på backend – från affärslogik och datamodellering till API:er och integrationer. Du gillar att förstå helheten men trivs bäst när du får bygga stabila, effektiva och framtidssäkra system.
 



  





 Vår techstack består av .NET Core/C# i backend och React i frontend. Systemet är redan i drift men under ständig utveckling.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 



* Du har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling i team, gärna inom distribuerade system eller molnbaserade lösningar.
* Du är van att ta tekniskt ansvar och bidra i arkitektur- och designbeslut.
* Du har god förståelse för databaser, API-design, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Du är nyfiken, initiativtagande och gillar att jobba nära både produkt och användare.
* Du har en högskoleutbildning inom datateknik eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Du har ett intresse för hållbar energi och ser det som meningsfullt att bidra till energiomställningen.
* Du kommunicerar både svenska och engelska obehindrat.



  





**Vilka är vi?** 




 Efter vår resa som snabbväxande startup har vi nu tagit nästa steg och blivit en del av en etablerad familjeägd koncern med starkt kapital och långsiktigt engagemang. Det ger oss det bästa av två världar: startup-energin och innovationskraften, kombinerat med tryggheten och resurserna hos en stabil ägare.
 



  





 Energibranschen står inför en enorm förändring – från storskalig energiproduktion till lokal, förnybar produktion och lagring av energi. Vår mjukvara banar väg för energiomställningen och möjliggör mer flexibel och intermittent kraft i energisystemet. Vi är stolta över att ha ett team bestående av några av branschens bästa och mest engagerade experter, som är dedikerade att göra förnybara energikällor lönsamma.
 



  





**Bra att veta** 




 Placeringsort är Stockholm med möjlighet till distansarbete någon dag per vecka. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med tillträde snarast. Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning. Urval sker löpande så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



  





 🚀 Redo att vara med och utveckla framtidens energisystem?
 



 Ansök via vår rekryteringssida - klicka här 👉 Ansök till Full-Stack Developer

Vår mjukvara banar väg för energiomställningen och möjliggör mer flexibel och intermittent kraft i energisystemet. Vi är stolta över att ha ett team bestående av några av branschens bästa och mest engagerade experter, som är dedikerade att göra förnybara energikällor lönsamma.

title: 🔥 Join Our Startup as Co-founder/Partner – CTO (Fullstack) and/or Chief AI Officer – Build the Platform of the Future – Sweden Only!
description:
**🚀 Join SacsiN (Start Up) – We are looking for a CTO/Full-Stack Developer and a CAIO/Chief AI Officer Wanted to Build a Global Sustainability & Compliance Platform from the Ground Up.** 




  





**SacsiN is a Swedish startup on a mission to transform how sustainability and compliance are managed across global supply chains.** 









 We are building a highly scalable, Microsoft Azure-based platform that enables companies – from multinational corporations to small suppliers– to exchange standardized sustainability and compliance data in real time, supporting high volumes of users and queries with a strong focus on international supply chain networks.
 



  





 After five years of developing a proof of concept together with our member companies – including large multinational corporations with a combined experience of hundreds of years in the fields – we are now ready to build the SacsiN platform. SacsiN member companies have contributed valuable insights throughout the process, ensuring that our concept is built on real-world needs and challenges within sustainability and compliance.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 We are looking for
 **one or two highly experienced Full Stack Developers/Platform Engineer and CAIO/Chief AI Officer** 
**professional** 
 to join SacsiN and to build and scale the platform from the ground up. We already have an MVP-Minimum Viable Product.
 



  





**Who we’re looking for:** 




**Ideally, you have 10+ years of hands-on experience designing and building scalable software platforms and delivering complex systems and AI solutions from scratch – or equivalent proven expertise.** 
 It is important to be able to work independently as you are building the platform almost from scratch.
 



  




* Proven track record and expert of building
 **large-scale, cloud-based platforms from scratch**
* Proven track record and expert of building
 
 Expert in
 **full stack development** 
 (backend with .NET Core, Node.js, Python; frontend with React or similar)
* Proven track record and expert of building advanced
 
 AI/ML
* Deep knowledge of
 **Microsoft Azure** 
 – including App Services, Functions, Cosmos DB, Blob Storage, Front Door, Key Vault, etc
* Strong
 **architecture** 
 skills focused on global
 **scalability, security, and modularity**
* Experience integrating
 **global payment solutions, identity & access management, and secure document handling**
* Skilled at building
 **interactive dashboards/visualization** 
 with Power BI, D3.js, React, or similar
* Experience with
 **CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, and fault-tolerant design**
* Experience with
 **blockchain or similar technologies for traceability**
* Experience
 
 of
 **low-code tools** 
 where appropriate
* Be responsible for
 **load balancing, high availability, fault tolerance, and cost optimization** 
 of the cloud infrastructure to ensure global performance and reliability.
* Fluent English (Swedish not required)
* **Legally authorized** 
 to live and work in
 **Sweden**
* **Work independently,** 
 it is important that you have the required expertise, as this role comes with significant responsibility to rapidly build the platform from scratch, either independently or together with a colleague, ensuring it is built on the right architecture from the start.



  





**🌟 What We Can Offer:** 



* A unique opportunity to become the
 **first CTO/Full Stack and CAIO/Chief AI Officer** 
 in a fast-moving and purpose-driven startup environment.
* Full ownership to
 **design and build the platform architecture from scratch** 
 , using modern, scalable technologies.
* **Flexible working conditions** 
 – remote with frequent meetings in Stockholm.
* The freedom to
 **innovate, shape and maintain** 
 both technology and processes in line with real-world global sustainability challenges.
* A meaningful mission:
 **streamline B2B information exchange** 
 in sustainability and compliance, helping companies meet legal obligations and creating transparent chains of custody that reach all the way to consumers.



  





 💰
 **Compensation in this early-phase is based entirely on a profit-sharing model or stockoptions** 
 – meaning no salary is paid until profit allows salary to be payed.
 



  





 🧭
 **Workload: 50–100% depending on your availability.** 




 💻 We are now building our core team for long-term collaboration. To make teamwork easier and more engaging,
 **we are only looking for candidates based in Sweden, ideally in the Stockholm area,** 
 so that we can meet in person regularly when needed, while also allowing for remote work when possible.
 



 🕒
 **We are ready to start immediately** 




  





**How to apply:** 




 In your application, please
 **introduce yourself, tell us a bit about your background** 
 , and explain how your experience matches what we’re looking for and the
 **experience building scalable cloud platforms from the ground up** 
 . This is a key selection criterion.
 



  






 We are open to engage one or two candidates who have a proven track record of working efficiently together and complement each other's skills.
 




  





 Please note that as a start-up with limited HR resources, our response times may be longer than usual. We appreciate your patience.
 



  





 www.sacsin.com

title: Developer & Module Specialist - SuccessFactors
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att vidareutveckla och driva HR-system i en organisation med starkt fokus på tillväxt och innovation? Vi söker nu en certifierad SuccessFactors Developer and Module Specialist till vårt framåtriktade interna IT-team!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som SuccessFactors Developer and Module Specialist kommer du att inneha en expertroll i vår interna IT-organisation och arbeta nära HR-funktionen. Du kommer att förvalta, integrera och implementera funktionalitet i SuccessFactors olika moduler. Genom ditt arbete kommer du att säkerställa en smidig, stabil och snabb implementering av ny programvara och uppdateringar i installerade applikationer. Du kommer att tillsammans med övriga teamet medverka i frågor rörande aktuella och framtida vägval för plattformens tekniska utveckling.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Ansvara för ny systemkonfiguration samt sätta sig in i befintlig konfiguration
* Utföra felsökning och problemlösning när systemet inte fungerar som förväntat
* Hitta lösningar på komplexa problem och stödja organisationen i implementeringen av nya funktioner
* Assistera vid uppgraderingar genom att förstå SAP:s processer och sätta sig in i dokumentation kring uppgraderingens nyheter
* Hålla koll på SuccessFactors roadmap och föreslå hur ny funktionalitet kan integreras i systemet
* Assistera med testning av ny funktionalitet
* Bistå med bakgrundsmaterial och delta i diskussioner med SAP Support vid komplexa supportärenden
* Kontinuerligt vidareutbilda systemadministratörerna för att stärka deras kompetens


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Du jobbar redan idag som applikationskonsult/specialist inom SuccessFactors-området och är expert på SuccessFactors EC (Employee Central). Denna roll kräver en konfigureringsexpert med medellång (3–5 års) erfarenhet som är eller har varit certifierad i SuccessFactors EC-modul och/eller någon av följande moduler: LMS, PMGM eller Compensation¨
* Du har en akademisk examen inom IT eller motsvarande
* Har erfarenhet av att samarbeta med olika intressenter och förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett enkelt och pedagogiskt sätt.
* Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Som person brinner du för att uppnå verksamhetsnytta med hjälp av IT och verkar för att säkerställa leveranser med hög kvalitet. Du har en stark analytisk förmåga och kan se helheten i komplexa IT-system och HR-processer. Du är självständig och leveranssäker i ditt arbete med lätt för såväl reaktiv som proaktiv problemlösning. Ditt team lägger stort fokus på innovation och utveckling och vi ser därför gärna att du delar vårt intresse för att se möjligheter i varje process.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande roll i en organisation som värdesätter innovation och förbättring. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med de senaste HR-teknologierna i en miljö med starkt fokus på digitalisering. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och tillitsbaserad arbetsmiljö där din kompetens och erfarenhet gör skillnad, samt goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och påverkan inom din roll.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-09-19**

title: Product manager – Machine and Equipment Tracking
description:
**Are you ready to shape the future of smart asset tracking across Europe?** 
 At ABAX, we help businesses with mobile workforces work smarter — cutting costs, improving efficiency, and driving sustainability. Now, we’re growing fast and looking for a Product Manager to take full ownership of one of our most exciting product areas: Machine & Equipment Tracking.
   

  

 As
 **Product Manager,** 
 you’ll sit at the heart of an empowered, cross-functional team — defining strategy, guiding execution, and owning outcomes. This is your chance to lead a product that blends IoT innovation with tangible, real-world impact. From construction tools to heavy machinery, you’ll help businesses track and manage assets with precision and intelligence.
   

  

 We’re seeking someone with a strong, hands-on product management background — ideally with experience aligning product strategy to commercial goals. You know how to balance user needs, technical feasibility, and business value — and you're passionate about creating products that drive growth and customer success.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and lead the product strategy in alignment with ABAX’s broader goals
* Leverage data and market insights to identify customer pain points and solve real problems
* Drive the product lifecycle end to end — from concept to launch and beyond
* Collaborate closely with engineering, UX, and commercial teams
* Own and iterate the product roadmap — delivering value early and often
* Create clear, outcome-focused user stories and champion seamless user experiences


**What You Bring**
* Proven experience scaling B2B cloud products as a Product Manager
* A relevant degree in technology, engineering, or a related field
* Solid understanding of both hardware and software, ideally with insight into the machine & equipment domain
* Enthusiastic, innovative, customer-obsessed, and sustainability-minded
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to work across discipline


**What You’ll Gain**
* End-to-end ownership of a rapidly scaling product
* A visible, influential role shaping product development and company impact
* Opportunity to work with scalable solutions and future-ready technology
* A strong company culture based on accountability, trust, and teamwork


**Other Information**
* Start date: As soon as possible
* Work extent: Full-time
* Location: Stockholm. Hybrid working available.


**Background check and Reference verification:**
 Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, an advanced online solution for managing this procedure.
   

  

 Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities:**
 At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.
   

  

**About ABAX:**
 ABAX is a leading European telematics IoT platform offering connected mobility solutions for vehicle tracking, tool tracking, and equipment control. Our mission is to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less.
   

  

 With over 500,000 tracked assets and 40,000 customers, ABAX delivers reliable and powerful solutions for businesses relying on physical operations. Our advanced platform transforms customer needs into actionable insights and automated reporting, driving efficiency and operational excellence.
   

  

 We operate across Europe, with close to 300 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

title: Principal AI/ML Architect
description:
We are seeking a Principal Architect to lead the development of Infor M3 solutions powered by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML).
   

 This role will play a key part in expanding our cloud architecture capabilities, while partnering across the organization to build, deploy, and scale intelligent systems. You will also help drive talent transformation to ensure the workforce is future-ready for AI-powered technologies.
   

  

 As a core member of the Cloud and Container Native Platform organization, you will be the driving force behind enabling internal teams to adopt and embed AI/ML capabilities within the software development lifecycle (SDLC). You’ll operate both as a solution architect and an AI/ML evangelist, collaborating across engineering, product, and customer-facing teams. This includes external engagements when needed to support AI/ML initiatives.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

 \* Lead architecture and development of AI/ML-enhanced Infor M3 solutions
   

 \* Partner with cross-functional teams to design, build, and maintain AI/ML-enabled systems
   

 \* Evolve and scale cloud-native AI/ML architectures to drive business innovation
   

 \* Champion talent transformation initiatives to build internal AI/ML capability
   

 \* Drive change management to align technical initiatives with strategic goals
   

 \* Represent AI/ML initiatives in internal and external discussions
   

  

 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

 \* 10-15+ years in software, solution, or enterprise architecture with hands-on delivery of production-grade AI/ML systems
   

 \* Deep expertise in cloud architecture on at least one hyperscaler (AWS, Azure, GCP) with ability to design and optimize cloud-native AI workloads
   

 \* Proven MLOps and ML platform experience: data pipelines, model lifecycle (training, evaluation, deployment), CI/CD, and monitoring
   

 \* Working knowledge of Generative AI / LLMs: prompting, fine-tuning, and rapid prototyping
   

 \* Strong foundation in SaaS, multi-tenant architectures, microservices, and APIs—particularly around integrating AI into products and workflows
   

 \* Excellent communication skills: able to engage both executives (whiteboarding) and engineers (deep technical dives)
   

 \* Solid understanding of security, privacy, and compliance considerations in enterprise AI (e.g., data governance, model safety)
   

 \* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent; advanced degrees or equivalent experience also considered
   

 \* Skilled at presenting complex technical topics at both abstract and implementation levels
   

  

 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

 \* Experience with Agentic AI/orchestration frameworks (tool use, lifecycle, interoperability)
   

 \* Familiarity with LangChain, LLMOps tools, vector search/RAG, retrieval pipelines
   

 \* Knowledge of Responsible AI practices, including governance, risk, human-in-the-loop, and auditability in enterprise settings
   

 \* Consulting or industry solutions background, with ability to map domain needs to AI architectures
   

 \* Recognized technical leadership through publishing, mentoring, or internal standards contributions
   

 \* Relevant certifications (AWS/GCP/Azure, Snowflake/Databricks) or EA frameworks (TOGAF)
   

 \* Experience aligning AI/ML with enterprise roadmaps and platforms (e.g., SAP/RISE, Salesforce/Agentforce, ServiceNow)
   

  

 About Infor
   

  

 Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
   

 For more information visit www.infor.com
   

  

 Our Values
   

  

 At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called [1] Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.
   

  

 We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
   

  

 Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.
   

  

 At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read [2] here.
   

  

  

 References
   

  

 Visible links
   

 1. https://www.kochind.com/about/business-philosophy
   

 2. https://www.infor.com/about/privacy

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Web Systems
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

**About the Role:**
*We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.*
*We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.*
 The
 **Senior Engineering Manager** 
 for Web Systems (Recommender Journey) is responsible for the work of a newly created team which will own the comprehensive web experience for users of Tobii Dynavox products. It will be used by professionals as well as people in informal care circles who work to serve users of our solutions. The Senior Engineering Manager for Web Systems (Recommender Journey) will lead this team to define, architect, implement and maintain this ecosystem, thus ensuring its long-term contribution to our product offerings.
   

  

**In this role, you will**
* Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of highly competent software engineers.
* Lead the definition of the architecture which supports the overarching web experience with respect to the individual products and services.
* Oversee the design, development, and deployment of the web experience using React and other front-end technologies, but with a C#/.NET back end.
* Establish and maintain high quality design and development processes.
* Maintain high reliability and availability of the products.
* Collaborate with peers in the engineering department to ensure the architectural integrity of the entire portfolio.
* Drive continuous improvements in development processes, tools, and methodologies.


**What We're Looking For**
* Minimum of five years development experience.
* Minimum of four years management experience.
* Significant experience in C#/.NET
* Significant experience in Web development
* Expert in Agile/Scrum
* Able to contribute to architectural discussions/decisions
* Demonstrated experience with and sensitivity to UX design concerns.
* Strong leadership experience and excellent communication skills
* Proficient in providing and receiving feedback in a supportive manner.


***Please note that our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual during July and August due to the holiday period. We appreciate your patience and will get back to you as soon as possible. Wishing you a lovely summer!***
 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: SDM Nyckelroll i ett internationellt växande IT-bolag
description:
Om TechServices IT
  
  

TechServices IT AB är en del av Modica Capital-koncernen och levererar IT-tjänster till den offentliga sektorn. Med verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Indien har vi en stark internationell närvaro och en bred leveranskapacitet.
  
  

Vi är ett snabbväxande bolag med omsättning på ca 25 MSEK/år och har ramavtal med de flesta stora aktörerna inom offentlig sektor i Sverige. Vårt fokus är att leverera B2B-tjänster inom IT-drift, support och outsourcing, med högsta kvalitet och kundnöjdhet.
  
  

Nu söker vi en Service Delivery Manager (SDM) till vårt kontor i Hjärup som vill ta över ansvaret för vår leveransorganisation och bli en nyckelperson i vår fortsatta tillväxtresa.
  
Om rollen
  
Som Service Delivery Manager får du det övergripande ansvaret för att våra leveranser sker enligt avtal, SLA och förväntningar. Rollen är både operativ och strategisk – du ansvarar för kundnöjdhet, kvalitet och processutveckling, samtidigt som du bygger upp en skalbar leveransmodell i takt med att vi växer vidare i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Indien.
  
  

För att lyckas i rollen måste du vara väldigt social, säljande och relationsbyggande, men framför allt extremt strukturerad. Det är ofta högt tempo, många saker händer parallellt, och du måste kunna hålla ordning, prioritera rätt och leverera utan att tappa kontrollen.
  
  

Ansvarsområden
  
Säkerställa att alla leveranser sker enligt avtal, SLA och kvalitetskrav.
  
Vara primär kontaktperson för kunder och partners vid operativa och taktiska frågor.
  
Koordinera, stötta och följa upp våra konsulter ute på uppdrag.
  
Driva incident- och problemhantering samt hantera eskalationer.
  
Ansvara för dokumentation, rapportering och kontinuerliga förbättringar i leveransprocessen.
  
Bygga upp och vidareutveckla leveransmodellen för internationell expansion.
  
Stötta säljorganisationen i presale, upphandlingar och överlämningar till delivery.
  
Samarbeta nära med våra systerbolag i Norge, Finland och Indien.
  
Dra in nya kunder
  
Vem vi söker
  
Vi söker en strukturerad, affärsorienterad och kommunikativ ledare som också är social, säljande och stark i att bygga relationer.
  
  

Avskräckande krav – läs noga innan du söker
  
Om du inte är riktigt strukturerad och kan hålla ordning även under press – sök inte.
  
Om du blir stressad av högt tempo och många bollar i luften – sök inte.
  
Om du inte kan hantera både operativa detaljer och strategiska beslut parallellt – sök inte.
  
Om du inte klarar av att prata med både tekniker och chefer på ett professionellt, lösningsorienterat sätt – sök inte.
  
Det här är en roll för dig som älskar utmaningar, vill ha stort ansvar och klarar att leverera även när förutsättningarna ändras snabbt.
  
Kravprofil
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av Service Delivery, projektledning, IT-drift eller liknande roll.
  
Förmåga att kombinera tekniskt förståelse med affärsmässigt fokus.
  
  

Mycket god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
  
  

Van att arbeta i en internationell miljö.
  
  

Hög stresstålighet, stark förmåga att prioritera och skapa struktur.
  
  

Meriterande
  
ITIL-certifiering eller erfarenhet av processledning.
  
Tidigare erfarenhet från outsourcing, leverantörsled eller konsultbolag.
  
Erfarenhet av att bygga och utveckla team i växande organisationer.
  
Kunskaper i norska eller finska.
  
Vi erbjuder
  
En nyckelroll i ett internationellt växande IT-bolag.
  
Möjlighet att påverka bolagets framtida leveransmodell i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Indien.
  
En arbetsmiljö med korta beslutsvägar och direkt rapportering till VD.
  
En vardag med ramavtal hos de flesta stora aktörerna inom offentlig sektor i Sverige.
  
Konkurrenskraftig lön och villkor.
  
Möjlighet att växa med bolaget och på sikt ta en ännu större ledarroll.
  
Ansökan
  
Skicka in din ansökan och CV till paolino.modica@techservicesit.se
  
.Urval sker löpande – vänta inte med att ansöka!
  
**Observera:** Referenser kommer att kontaktas som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
  
För frågor angående tjänsten, vänligen kontakta Paolino Modica på +46 70367 77 00

title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
description:
### **General Information**

**Locations**: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
  

Role ID
209768
Worker Type
Regular Employee
Studio/Department
CT - Frostbite
Work Model
Hybrid
### **Description & Requirements**

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
**Frostbite** is EA's proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine uniquely adapts to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline.


As a **Machine Learning Software Engineer** in the Frostbite Quality AI team, you will design machine learning systems that improve engineering efficiency for Frostbite and our games. You will collaborate with other software engineers, data engineers and quality analysts. You will report to the Senior Manager of Engine Development of Quality Engineering. Our team promotes a culture of learning, innovation and continuous improvement.

**Responsibilities**

* Design machine learning-based solutions to real-world software development workflow problems.
* Build end-to-end systems, including model evaluation, deployment, data collection, debugging, performance improvement, and monitoring.
* Collaborate with data engineers to design real-time data processing that allows dynamic context and improved inference.
* Write clean, well-documented, well-tested code that integrates smoothly with existing codebases.
* Stay up-to-date on advancements in deep learning and generative AI through self-study and internal and external conferences.
* Be an active member of EA's growing AI/ML community, communicating to partners, sharing knowledge, and mentoring other team members to develop their skills.

**Qualifications**

* BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics, or equivalent experience.
* 2+ years of experience developing ML systems.
* Proficient in Python.
* Expertise in ML frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or MLFlow.
* Experience with large-scale machine learning, including big data and model deployment in distributed computing environments.
* Familiarity with the machine learning ecosystems of cloud providers (AWS, Azure).
* Proficiency in good software engineering practices (version control, unit testing, code reviews).

**Bonus if you have...**

* Familiarity with software quality processes, test automation, or game development processes.


This is a hybrid remote/in-office role. #LI-Hybrid

  

  

  

***About Electronic Arts***
We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.  

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.  

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
company_addresses: 209 Redwood Shores Parkway Redwood City, CA 94065

title: Software Engineers to Zalando
description:
**About The Company And The Role**
 We are looking for two Software Engineers to join Zalando, an international e-commerce company that is shaping the future of retail. This company provides a platform that serves millions of customers worldwide and is now expanding its engineering team to continue delivering innovative solutions. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with technologies such as Java, Kotlin, AWS, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch, all while collaborating with passionate teams focused on driving innovation.
   

  

 In the role of Software Engineer, you’ll develop and operate large-scale systems that ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment. Your primary focus will be to build backend applications that handle high volumes of data and deliver seamless experiences for customers and partners.
   

  

 At Zalando, you’ll be part of a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. This role offers you the chance to contribute to an innovative, customer-centric organization that is reshaping the future of online retail.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Developing and maintaining high-performance, low-latency systems for data streaming and processing.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and scale solutions for fulfillment and customer experience.
* Taking ownership of applications, managing them from development through deployment and monitoring.
* Innovating and finding solutions to scale the platform in an increasingly complex ecosystem.
* Actively contributing to the development of new features and improvements.


 You’ll contribute to Zalando’s success by ensuring the systems you build directly enhance the customer experience. As a Software Engineer, you’ll be challenged by the complexity of building distributed systems at scale and will have the opportunity to collaborate across teams and countries.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
* A relevant degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* Professional experience in software engineering.
* Solid experience with Java or Kotlin and building APIs.
* Familiarity with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and event-driven architectures.
* Some experience or interest in AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch.
* A passion for problem-solving and building scalable solutions.
* Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Kubernetes) and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of Kafka or similar messaging systems.
* Experience working with large-scale, high-availability systems.


 We are looking for candidates who are proactive, innovative, and motivated to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Scope: Full-time position (100%)
   

  

 Location: Stockholm.
   

  

 Selection process: We apply continuous selection, which means the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, feel free to contact the responsible recruiter Ronja Bergman on ronja.bergman@techtalents.se
   

  

 Does this sound like the position for you? We look forward to hearing from you – warmly welcome with your application!
   

  

 In this recruitment, Zalando is collaborating with Tech Talents, and we direct applications to Tech Talents.

title: (Senior) Applications & Technology Architect  – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for Information Systems Directorate (IS), Enterprise Architecture Unit (EA), at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Senior) Applications & Technology Architect** 
**\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* Internal benchmark: (Senior) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from June 2025*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you driven by the challenge of designing high-level application architectures that empower businesses to thrive?
   

  

 Do you excel at integrating complex solutions, drawing from diverse technology stacks, and leading innovation from concept to execution?
   

  

 We’re looking for a visionary architect, someone who understands that every design choice impacts the future of business operations and recognizes the power of thoughtful architecture in shaping digital transformation.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll take the lead in defining and managing our application and technology architecture. You’ll plan the structure of new systems, oversee implementation, collaborate closely with key stakeholders, and champion architectural awareness across the organization.
   

  

 Ready to make a lasting impact? Join us and help shape the future.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The role of the Enterprise Architecture Unit is to support the EIB Group to convert traditional businesses and ways of working to digital ones, using the potential of modern technologies and data. The aim is to establish a comprehensive business transformation strategy, synchronised with operational imperatives, and aligned with the overarching Digital strategy and vision. It ensures alignment in the strategic transformation journey while maintaining a consistent architecture.
   

  

 It facilitates the discussions between the Value Chains (VC) and platforms and support and monitor the Value Chains in their business processes optimisation, the delivery of solutions and activation of innovation.
   

  

 In this position, you would report directly to the Head of Unit.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Lead application & technology architecture practice. You won't just follow the trends; you'll set them. Share your vision and make a mark across the board by establishing cutting-edge principles, standards, and guidelines.
* Design Tomorrow's Solutions, Today. Dive into the heart of our operations, joining forces with our elite Solution Architects and Delivery teams. Your collaborative spirit and foresight will help sculpt the enterprise's future, ensuring our architectural efforts are not just current but pioneering.
* Navigate details across various layers, encompassing business, application, technology, data, operations, and security, the architect will exhibit exceptional proficiency in guiding the development of comprehensive, forward-looking solutions.
* Maintain the architectural body of knowledge by documenting the architectural designs in place and manage the initiatives (knowledge repository that encompass any relevant matter linked to architecture such as prioritisation, feedbacks problems or new ideas and guides architectural development)
* Turn Opportunities into innovations, with a keen eye for optimization, you'll continually enhance our application and technology landscape.
* Ensure the alignment between Application Architecture practices with markets standards and best practices, including relevant monitoring activities
* Work closely with senior leaders, transforming business needs into technological solutions, building architectural bridges that enhance our journey from aspiration to reality.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* At least 5 years of relevant professional experience as an Enterprise/ Technology/ Application Architect or similar role, with a track record of successfully delivering complex application projects
* In-depth knowledge of application architecture principles, design patterns, and integration techniques
* Expertise in multiple technology stacks, languages, and frameworks commonly used in application development
* Understanding of data architecture, including database design, data modeling, and data integration
* Experience in designing solutions that encompass application, integration, data, and business layers, fostering a unified and coherent ecosystem, preferably in Cloud environment
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open position. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: SMB Sales Specialist
description:
**Company Description**
  

 Devoteam is a leading technology partner to Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft across EMEA. With 20+ years of successful Google Cloud implementations and a team of certified experts, we drive digital transformation across various industries.
   

  

 At Devoteam, we champion a revolutionary "New Way of Work" that prioritises flexibility, personal growth, and joint success.
   

  

  
   

  

  

**Job Description**
  

 Drive Digital Transformation: Become a Mid-Market Cloud Advisor
   

* As a Cloud Advisor for Google Cloud and other cloud technologies at Devoteam, you will play a crucial role in expanding our footprint across the Nordics and DACH. You will be responsible for:
* Hunting for New Business: Identify and acquire new customers with a focus on medium-sized businesses, generating leads and building strong relationships with key decision-makers.
* Driving Revenue Growth: Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve ambitious targets, exceeding customer expectations and contributing to Devoteam's continued success with hyperscalers and ISVs.
* Mastering the Sales Cycle: Own the entire sales process, from initial contact and needs analysis to proposal development, negotiation, and closing deals.
* Building Long-Term Partnerships: Cultivate strong relationships with existing clients, identifying opportunities to expand our services and ensure their ongoing success in all areas of their technology procurement.


 Staying Ahead of the Curve: Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Cloud ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends.
   

  

  
   

  

 Success Stories:
   

  

*"Joining Devoteam in the Nordics has been a transformative experience. The support from the local tech teams and the clear growth path have enabled me to consistently exceed my sales targets."
   

  

 — Aliha Mahmood, Junior Sales, Sweden*
*"Transitioning from Google to Devoteam has been a remarkable experience. The collaborative culture and unwavering commitment to innovation at Devoteam have empowered me to utilize my Google Cloud expertise to its fullest potential. Working with cutting-edge Google Cloud solutions here has significantly advanced my career and allowed me to deliver exceptional value to our clients."
   

  

 — Thomas Brunn, Sales Executive, Norway*
 Territory
   

* You'll be working with startups and mid-market corporations across the Nordic or the DACH region, primarily digital natives.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Proven Hunter: Demonstrated success in acquiring new customers and closing deals in the IT project business, with a focus on hyperscaler technologies.
* Solution-Oriented Mindset: Ability to understand client challenges and translate them into effective Cloud solutions.
* Strong Communication & Presentation Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate the value proposition of Cloud to C-level executives.
* Relationship Builder: A natural networker who can build rapport and establish trust with clients and internal stakeholders.
* Results-Driven: Highly motivated and results-oriented, with a strong work ethic and a commitment to exceeding expectations.
* Languages: Excellent written and spoken English skills are essential. Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus. In DACH fluent German is a requirement.


        
   

  

  

**Additional Information**
  

 Devoteam is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

  

  

 Benefits:
   

* Flexible Work Arrangements: Enjoy a hybrid work model with the freedom to choose your working hours and location.
* Career Development: Access to the Devoteam Academy for certified training and language courses, supporting your professional growth.
* International Opportunities: Explore potential career opportunities within our global network.
* Vibrant Culture: Be part of a dynamic and supportive team with regular social events and team-building activities.

title: Customer Success Representative Sweden
description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech-enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we are now looking for a Swedish speaking Customer Success Representative to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.
   

  

**The role**
 The role of Customer Success Representative involves supporting our Swedish customers via all of our inbound contact channels, phone, chat and email. You will resolve our customers errands which will be broad and varied, it can be anything from technical support regarding our Qred Visa card, questions about an ongoing loan application or help regarding invoices. You will take full ownership of the customer's errands and drive customer satisfaction through excellent customer service. You will be exposed to many parts of our business, giving you insights into both our Underwriting and Collections processes. In this role you will collaborate with colleagues in the team as well as other stakeholders and departments to drive errand resolution. We have grown the Swedish Customer Success team immensely in the past year, and also received our banking license at the end of last year. Therefore, you will also have an impact on new routines and ways of working both internally and on how we operate towards our customers.
   

  

 In this role, you will be a part of a large and diverse team of 19 people that houses Underwriters, Customer Success, and Collection Agents among others. This role reports to one of two Team Leads.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage inbound customer errands, via phone, chat, email.
* Take full ownership of the resolution and the customer facing contact.
* Collaborate with colleagues both within and outside the team to drive improvements.


**Qualifications**
* Experience in customer service, preferably via phone and email
* Basic knowledge of financial products
* Proven capabilities in high customer satisfaction
* Strong sense of ownership & detail orientation
* Curiosity and a will to constantly want to improve
* Experience from previous fintech and/or fast growing company is a plus
* Fluency in Swedish, both written and spoken
* Proficient in English, as it's our primary business language


**One last thing - if you’re about to send in your application**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm with working hours Monday-Friday 8:30-17:30. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Director, Consult Partner--Application Services
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Kyndryl Consult is the fastest growing business within the organization and instrumental to the company’s strategic growth objectives. You will play a key leadership role across multi-disciplinary teams, guiding them through complex consulting engagements and be responsible for creating and positioning strategic change agendas within Kyndryl's largest accounts across the C-suite, spanning the intersection between complex Business and IT customer solutions, transformations that impact across the entire customer Eco-system.
   

  

 As a Consult Partner, you will have a pivotal role in driving profitable growth, leveraging our comprehensive capabilities to build strong client relationships, and leading your team to success. This role demands a strong presence, industry expertise, and the ability to cultivate relationships with CXO-level clients. Your leadership will be critical in fostering talent development and innovation within the organization.
   

  

 This role will also be leading the overall client engagement and delivering high quality client work alongside senior client stakeholders. Working in a transaction environment which may be pre or post deal, planning post deal implementation, and ultimately supporting execution. Partners will be focused on financial impact, utilization and contribution, client impact and leadership.
   

  

 Contribute to Profitable Growth:
   

  

* Drive significant financial outcomes through signings and revenue targets
* Ensure sustained growth and profitability, managing margin expectations and backlog growth
* Support the identification, pursuit and conversion of a pipeline of business development opportunities
* Undertake scoping and fee negotiation on engagements, while enduring profitability and understanding and containing risk


 Client Engagement:
   

  

* Build and maintain deep relationships with client CXOs and be seen as the 'go to' person and a trusted advisor by senior executives
* Leading C-level client interactions and consulting initiatives, deliverables and outputs of a deal engagement
* Demonstrate credibility and experience to advise and deliver on complex consulting engagement
* Enhance client satisfaction, as measured by Net Promoter Score (NPS) and new relationship development; Secure client references


 Operational Excellence:
   

  

* Achieve individual and team utilization targets
* Lead the design of complex engagements and take responsibility for oversight of delivery, ensuring high performance and customer satisfaction


 Leadership, Management, People
   

  

* Lead by example; Fostering a culture of continuous personal and professional development and challenging our people to be curious and innovative and supportive for each other. At the same time ensuring that all outcomes are commercially focused, value adding and effectively executed


 Strategic Contribution:
   

  

* Utilize industry and technology expertise to shape and drive the company’s strategic initiatives.
* Align with Kyndryl’s strategic vision and contribute to its execution.
* Drive external eminence and innovation, establishing a strong personal and organizational brand in the industry.
* Proactively develop thought leadership and intellectual capital


**Who You Are**
 Who You Are
   

  

 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* 15+ years of experience in IT consulting and Sales, with focus on application services
* Extensive experience in client engagement and relationship management at the CXO level
* Demonstrable ability to build and commercialize relationships with senior executives
* Proven track record of leading and executing complex projects with multi-disciplinary teams in a consulting, corporate or public sector environment
* Effective financial acumen with experience in driving revenue growth and managing margins
* Experience of managing or supporting high-value business development activities with senior stakeholders
* Deep understanding of industry trends and technology
* Sound personal brand and presence in the industry
* Demonstrated ability to innovate and drive change
* Industry experience in Retail & Industrial Sectors
* Proven track record in pre-sales activities and solution design for large-scale Application Services engagements


**Preferred Skills and Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* Sales experience in technical solutions


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.
